History: Patient has been feeling low due thoughts of worthless and as if somewhere is stuck in life. They feels that their emotions are getting out of control and has started having suicidal ideations.
Crisis Markers: Suicidal ideation; Level of risk: Mild
Current Mental Status Examination: Behaviour: Patient was cooperative and rapport could be established; Mood: Depressed; Affect: Restricted; Thought: Preoccupation with thoughts of ending life and hopelessness
Issues discussed in Current Session: Patient consulted before the scheduled session as he was having recurrent suicidal thoughts. Overall severity of these ideations was understood and No Suicide Contract was signed.
Action Plan: Patient has been told to spend time with parents and stay their for a night to see if there is any improvement
